verses.text: But then their words contain a manifest absurdity.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:141
verses.text: Where is the smith, the carpenter, the shoemaker, who, without help and alone before the instruments of his trade, would say to himself; let us make the sword, let us put together the plough, let us make the boot? Does he not perform the work of his craft in silence? Strange folly, to say that any one has seated himself to command himself, to watch over himself, to constrain himself, to hurry himself, with the tones of a master! But the unhappy creatures are not afraid to calumniate the Lord Himself.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:142
verses.text: What will they not say with a tongue so well practised in lying? Here, however, words stop their mouth; "And God said let us make man".

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:143
verses.text: Tell me; is there then only one Person? It is not written "Let man be made," but, "Let us make man".

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:144
verses.text: The preaching of theology remains enveloped in shadow before the appearance of him who was to be instructed, but, now, the creation of man is expected, that faith unveils herself and the dogma of truth appears in all its light.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:145
verses.text: "Let us make man".

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:146
verses.text: O enemy of Christ, hear God speaking to His Co-operator, to Him by Whom also He made the worlds, Who upholds all things by the word of His power.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:147
verses.text: But He does not leave the voice of true religion without answer.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:148
verses.text: Thus the Jews, race hostile to truth, when they find themselves pressed, act like beasts enraged against man, who roar at the bars of their cage and show the cruelty and the ferocity of their nature, without being able to assuage their fury.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:149
verses.text: God, they say, addresses Himself to several persons; it is to the angels before Him that He says, "Let us make man".

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:150
verses.text: Jewish fiction! a fable whose frivolity shows whence it has come.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:151
verses.text: To reject one person, they admit many.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:152
verses.text: To reject the Son, they raise servants to the dignity of counsellors; they make of our fellow slaves the agents in our creation.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:153
verses.text: The perfect man attains the dignity of an angel; but what creature can be like the Creator? Listen to the continuation.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:154
verses.text: "In our image".

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:155
verses.text: What have you to reply? Is there one image of God and the angels? Father and Son have by absolute necessity the same form, but the form is here understood as becomes the divine, not in bodily shape, but in the proper qualities of Godhead.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:156
verses.text: Hear also, you who belong to the new concision and who, under the appearance of Christianity, strengthen the error of the Jews.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:157
verses.text: To Whom does He say, "in our image," to whom if it is not to Him who is "the brightness of His glory and the express image of His person," "the image of the invisible God"? It is then to His living image, to Him Who has said "I and my Father are one," "He that hath seen me hath seen the Father," that God says "Let us make man in our image".

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:158
verses.text: Where is the unlikeness in these Beings who have only one image? "So God created man".

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:159
verses.text: It is not "They made".

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:160
verses.text: Here Scripture avoids the plurality of the Persons.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:161
verses.text: After having enlightened the Jew, it dissipates the error of the Gentiles in putting itself under the shelter of unity, to make you understand that the Son is with the Father, and guarding you from the danger of polytheism.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:162
verses.text: He created him in the image of God.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:163
verses.text: God still shows us His co-operator, because He does not say, in His image, but in the image of God.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:164
verses.text: If God permits, we will say later in what way man was created in the image of God, and how he shares this resemblance.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:165
verses.text: Today we say but only one word.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:166
verses.text: If there is one image, from whence comes the intolerable blasphemy of pretending that the Son is unlike the Father? What ingratitude! You have yourself received this likeness and you refuse it to your Benefactor! You pretend to keep personally that which is in you a gift of grace, and you do not wish that the Son should keep His natural likeness to Him who begat Him.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:167
verses.text: But evening, which long ago sent the sun to the west, imposes silence upon me.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:168
verses.text: Here, then, let me be content with what I have said, and put my discourse to bed.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:169
verses.text: I have told you enough up to this point to excite your zeal; with the help of the Holy Spirit I will make for you a deeper investigation into the truths which follow.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:170
verses.text: Retire, then, I beg you, with joy, O Christ-loving congregation, and, instead of sumptuous dishes of various delicacies, adorn and sanctify your tables with the remembrance of my words.

verses.name: Basil The Great: Homilies 9:171
verses.text: May the Anomoean be confounded, the Jew covered with shame, the faithful exultant in the dogmas of truth, and the Lord glorified, the Lord to Whom be glory and power, world without end, Amen.
